parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hasten, urge on, desire earnestly. Probably strengthened from pous; to 'speed', i.e. Urge on; by implication, to await eagerly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To find by seeking out, discover. From ana and heurisko; to find out.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Infant, babe, child in arms. Of uncertain affinity; an infant literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A manger, feeding-trough, stall. From pateomai; a crib.
